page.title: 05Population of Melchbourne
page.content: Melchbourne is a small village, with a population of about 100 people. The structure of the population is very unbalanced. There is well over two thirds of the people of retiring age and over. The village has only got 13 children who are of school age or younger and four of those are in one family. Less than 30 households in the area are economically active. This pattern is unlikely to change as there is no future developement proposed in Melchbourne. The existing properties if they were to become vacant would not attract young families, as they are in the main, too small or purpose biult for the elderly.
